solution_line_template: In the first set there are {first_set_broken_marbles} broken marbles because {first_set_total_marbles} x {first_set_broken_percent_decimal} = <<{first_set_total_marbles}*{first_set_broken_percent_decimal}={first_set_broken_marbles}>>{first_set_broken_marbles}

In the second set there are {second_set_broken_marbles} broken marbles because {second_set_total_marbles} x {second_set_broken_percent_decimal} = <<{second_set_total_marbles}*{second_set_broken_percent_decimal}={second_set_broken_marbles}>>{second_set_broken_marbles}

There are {total_broken_marbles} broken marbles in total because {first_set_broken_marbles} + {second_set_broken_marbles} = <<{first_set_broken_marbles}+{second_set_broken_marbles}={total_broken_marbles}>>{total_broken_marbles}
